text: Castanopsis pedunculata is a tree in the family Fagaceae. The specific epithet ' is from the Latin meaning "having a peduncle". ==Description== Castanopsis pedunculata grows as a tree up to tall with a trunk diameter of up to . The brown bark is flaky to lenticellate. The coriaceous leaves measure up to long. Its ovoid nuts measure up to long. ==Distribution and habitat== Castanopsis pedunculata is endemic to Borneo. Its habitat is lowland dipterocarp forests up to altitude. ==References== pedunculata Category:Endemic flora of Borneo Category:Trees of Borneo Category:Plants described in 1968
title: Castanopsis pedunculata
